feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Values Missing in Leave Salary Accrual Report
known_issues.issue_explanation: Values are missing in columns M and N (Accrued Days, Provision Accrued for the month) of the Leave salary accrual report. The daily wage calculation uses calendar days, which may not match custom accounting requirements.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Report uses strict calendar days for daily wage calculation, preventing custom divisor configurations
known_issues.gap_statement: The system cannot accommodate custom daily wage calculation methods for different accounting practices

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate in remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation showed 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific leave calculation methods. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a global setting instead of policy-level basic salary / working days configuration.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing length of service, potentially adding an extra day to gratuity calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation method

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using specific day counting and leap year adjustment methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic is complex and not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. This means the same employee's salary can be prorated differently depending on whether it's a leave salary or regular salary proration.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use separate daily wage calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method across leave and proration scenarios

known_issues.title: Salary Proration Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates salary proration incorrectly by using 30 days instead of actual calendar days (31 days in August), and does not automatically recalculate prorations when daily rate configuration changes after employee offboarding.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform cannot automatically recalculate prorated salary when daily rate configuration changes after employee offboarding.
known_issues.gap_statement: There's a product gap in automatic proration recalculation when daily rate settings change, requiring manual intervention to trigger a new calculation.

known_issues.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: End of Service Calculation Challenges
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system automatically generates EOS deductions and salary arrears without precise proportional recalculation for employees with non-standard employment status changes, causing potential calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks sophisticated handling of complex employment status changes, particularly for employees who are offboarded and rehired in consecutive months.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a product gap in managing intricate payroll scenarios involving employee status transitions, specifically around EOS calculations, prorated salary, and arrears management for offboarded and rehired employees.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts consistently produces slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors. When calculating End of Service (EOS) amounts, the system shows amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Overwrite Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The greyed-out formula in leave policy indicates that the payroll configuration takes precedence, causing user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules.

known_issues.title: Multiple Leave Salary Policy Interaction Bugs
known_issues.issue_explanation: Two distinct bugs in leave salary policy configuration: (1) Changes to daily rate calculation in leave salary policy did not take effect until another leave salary policy was set to inactive, indicating incorrect policy precedence or caching issue when multiple leave salary policies exist. (2) Leave salary request was generated for a 5-day leave despite the policy requiring minimum 21 days, indicating the minimum days threshold validation is not working correctly.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently lacks robust handling of multiple active leave salary policies, causing conflicts in daily rate calculations and minimum days threshold enforcement.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in policy configuration management, specifically around leave salary policy interactions, precedence rules, and automatic validation of policy settings across different employee assignments.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic error in handling salary proration for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Wage Calculation Method
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage is currently being calculated based on basic salary, whereas it should be calculated using gross pay. This represents an incorrect calculation methodology for leave salary accrual reporting.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks flexible configuration for selecting the salary base (basic vs gross) for daily wage calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need to implement configurable daily wage calculation methods that allow selection between basic and gross pay.

known_issues.title: Inappropriate GOSI Component Appearance
known_issues.issue_explanation: A GOSI (social security) component is incorrectly appearing on reports for a UAE client who has not configured any social security contributions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks proper filtering for country-specific social security components.
known_issues.gap_statement: Require enhanced component filtering mechanisms to prevent irrelevant social security components from appearing based on country-specific configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals across different months
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, causing accrual reporting inconsistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Wage Calculation in Leave Salary Accrual Report
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system is not applying the configured leave encashment calculation method to the accrual report generation. Reports continue to calculate daily wage based on working days instead of the configured formula (Basic + allowances / 30 days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Platform has inconsistent handling of leave salary accrual calculation methods, where configured settings are not consistently applied across reporting modules.
known_issues.gap_statement: Synchronization gap between configuration settings and reporting logic for leave salary accrual calculations.

known_issues.title: EOS Daily Wage Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates daily wage by dividing total compensation by 21 working days instead of the expected 22 working days in the leave policy. This results in a different End of Service (EOS) calculation amount for employees.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system uses actual working days in a month rather than the predefined leave policy standard of 22 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of configurability in working days calculation for EOS and daily wage computations, with no manual override for public holiday exclusions.

known_issues.title: End of Service Leave Encashment Calculation Configuration UI Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When configuring leave encashment calculation, the End of Service Eligibility section does not immediately or clearly reflect configuration changes, causing user confusion about whether settings have been successfully applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Platform lacks transparent confirmation of configuration changes in the End of Service Eligibility section
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in providing clear, real-time visual feedback when users modify EOS leave encashment calculation settings.

known_issues.title: Unable to Edit Automatically Created Leave Deductions
known_issues.issue_explanation: System prevents administrators from editing or deleting automatically generated annual leave deductions in End of Service (EOS) calculations. Specifically, attempts to set deduction amounts to zero fail, and the system does not save changes.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Administrators cannot modify system-generated leave deductions in EOS calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in payroll configuration for automatically created deductions

known_issues.title: Incorrect End of Service Calculations for Mid-Month Leavers
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system does not accurately calculate End of Service (EOS) settlements for employees leaving mid-month with unpaid leave. It calculates EOS deductions using full monthly salary instead of the actual prorated amount paid.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform cannot dynamically adjust EOS calculations for employees with mid-month departures and unpaid leave periods.
known_issues.gap_statement: Platform lacks flexible EOS calculation logic to handle complex scenarios like partial month employment, unpaid leave, and prorated salary settlements.

known_issues.title: Unclear Prorated Salary Calculation Process
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current salary proration calculation lacks transparency in showing detailed calculation steps. Users cannot easily see how working days are counted and how the proration formula is applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Calculation breakdown and intermediate steps not visible in user interface
known_issues.gap_statement: Need to add more visible calculation fields that break down the proration process, showing total working days, included working days, and step-by-step calculation method directly in the user interface

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrectly Handles Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator does not correctly account for leap years in its calculation logic. When calculating gratuity for an employee with service spanning 2024 (a leap year), the system counts 365 days instead of 366 days, resulting in an incorrect total service period and gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Misunderstanding
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a non-standard divisor that may not align with user expectations of salary deductions
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Salary Deduction
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing accurate working days calculation when public holidays change.
known_issues.gap_statement: Module communication enhancement needed to ensure accurate salary deduction across different system configurations.

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on a fixed daily rate configuration in policy, which may differ from user expectations about calendar days. The specific ticket showed a calculation using 30 days instead of 31 calendar days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation follows a predefined policy setting that might not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations

known_issues.title: System vs Manual Gratuity Calculation Difference
known_issues.issue_explanation: Discrepancy between system gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) and manual calculation (AED 252,485) for end of service benefits
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation involves complex service duration and daily wage formula with tiered rates
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparency in gratuity calculation method

known_issues.title: Incorrect Gratuity Calculation for Limited Contracts
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system is producing inconsistent gratuity calculations for limited contract employees. The expected calculation (1200/30*21*2 = 1680 AED) does not match the system's generated amount. Calculation accuracy depends on departure reason and contract type.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic for limited contracts is unreliable and requires manual intervention.
known_issues.gap_statement: Significant product gap in gratuity calculation module for limited contract terminations, requiring manual workarounds.

known_issues.title: Lack of Customized Salary Proration Methods
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system currently applies a single proration approach across all employees, preventing differentiated calculation methods for distinct employee groups (Head Office vs Operations).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Cannot configure different salary proration calculation methods per employee category
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform needs enhanced salary proration configuration capabilities that support group-specific calculation methods

known_issues.title: Inconsistent UI Display for Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When 'Overwrite' option is enabled in Payroll Configuration → Daily Wage → Unpaid Leave Deduction, the Leave Policy UI shows 'Basic/calendar' while the actual calculation uses 'Basic + Allowance/calendar' from the payroll configuration. This creates user confusion about which calculation method is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks a clear visual indication when payroll configuration overrides leave policy settings.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a more transparent configuration interface that shows when system-level settings override specific policy configurations, with clear visual cues about the active calculation method.

known_issues.title: Missing Hourly Wage Information in Salary Configuration
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current salary configuration does not support hourly wage input, which limits detailed compensation management for users with hourly-based employees or complex wage structures.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Platform lacks flexibility in wage configuration, specifically the ability to document and track hourly wage rates alongside existing salary information.
known_issues.gap_statement: Unable to capture hourly wage details in the current salary configuration module

limitations.title: Nuanced Handling of Incomplete Service Years

1. Different calculation for first 5 years (21 days per year)
2. Different calculation for years above 5 years (30 days per year)
3. Special handling of incomplete final year using day-based prorated calculation
4. Leap year adjustment using 366 days divisor when applicable

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to use custom daily wage divisor in leave salary accrual report
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Report is designed for finance/accounting managers using calendar-based accrual calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution:
Manually edit exported report:
1. Change days in month (column J)
2. Divide column I by column J to get desired value
3. Recalculate subsequent columns using the adjusted values

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Remarks field shows incorrect number of days, but actual calculation uses correct calendar days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount by calculating daily rate using correct number of calendar days for the specific month

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect unpaid leave deduction amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected unpaid leave deduction amounts
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-level calculation settings
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify global unpaid leave daily rate settings before investigating policy-specific calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Difference in gratuity calculation between manual method and system calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation:
System uses precise day counting method, including:
1. Calculating exact days in partial years
2. Using 366 days divisor for leap years
3. Segmenting service period into different calculation tiers
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution:
Verify calculation by breaking down service period into specific segments:
1. First 5 years: 21 days per year
2. Years above 5: 30 days per year
3. Use precise day count for partial years
4. Account for leap year in day divisor

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect prorated salary calculation after daily rate configuration change
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System does not automatically update proration when daily rate settings are modified post-offboarding
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Rehire and re-offboard the employee to trigger recalculation of prorated amounts with the new daily rate configuration

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or orphaned payroll deductions after leave request modifications
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of synchronization between leave management and payroll deduction systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually review and remove duplicate deductions; contact system administrator for backend cleanup

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect salary arrears and EOS deduction for employees with complex employment status
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System automatically deducts full salary amount and recalculates proportionally based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual adjustment of arrear amount may be required; cannot delete platform-generated EOS deduction

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of service amounts show slightly lower values than expected
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify final settlement amounts manually and cross-check with expected calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Daily rate calculation changes not taking effect
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Multiple active leave salary policies prevent proper policy change propagation
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Deactivate other leave salary policies before making configuration changes

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary shown for partially worked month
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System does not dynamically adjust salary based on departure date relative to payroll processing
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary (e.g., Total monthly salary / 30 * days worked)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect daily wage calculations in leave salary accrual reports
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System using basic salary instead of gross pay for daily wage calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculations or contact support for correction

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent leave salary accrual totals across months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to use working days, which varies monthly
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave encashment calculations

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave salary accrual report shows incorrect daily wage calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Potential frontend or cache issues preventing correct application of configured calculation method
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify backend response and potentially invalidate cache to ensure correct calculation method is applied

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service Eligibility section shows outdated calculation method
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Potential UI synchronization issue or delayed configuration update
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify configuration by checking multiple sections or refreshing the page

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to modify or delete auto-created annual leave deductions
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System-level restriction on editing automatically generated payroll deductions
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Escalate to development team for manual intervention or system modification

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: System cannot automatically handle EOS calculation for mid-month leavers with unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Rigid backend calculation logic does not account for partial month employment or unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust departure date and perform calculations outside the system, or make manual adjustments to EOS settlement

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Confusion about how to calculate prorated salary for mid-month joining employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Proration calculation requires dividing (Basic salary + allowances) by total working days in month, then multiplying by actual working days in employment period
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate: (Basic + Allowances) / total working days in cycle * included working days in employment period

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Perceived incorrect salary proration
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Misunderstanding of how working days are calculated based on work week configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify work week configuration and understand that all days marked as working will be used in proration calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Confusion about how working days are counted for salary proration
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System automatically excludes weekends and calculates working days in the month
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify total working days by subtracting weekends from total calendar days in the month

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Deduction amount differs from expected monthly salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculated as 4300/30.42 = 141.35, then multiplied by days in leave period
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify unpaid leave policy settings and understand the 30.42 days divisor method

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent salary deduction due to public holiday changes
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Timing mismatch between Time Off and Payroll module calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually add deduction to correct the calculated amount

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between expected and calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation follows policy configuration, not calendar reality. Daily rate is divided based on predefined policy settings
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the system's divisor setting

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences between system and manual gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation involves complex service duration split and tiered daily rates (21 days/year for first 5 years, 30 days/year after)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculation using daily wage (13,800/30 = 460), apply tiered rates, and prorate partial years by days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Limited flexibility in leave accrual for mid-month departures
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System defaults to monthly accrual policy
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Configure conditional accrual policy for daily leave earning or manually adjust EOS balance

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect gratuity amount for limited contract employees
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic fails to consistently apply expected formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Manually update the amount
2. Change departure reason to 'End of contract' or 'Termination' to trigger correct calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inability to automatically prorate salaries for different employee groups
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of configurable proration calculation methods in the payroll system
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust salaries for employee groups with unique proration requirements

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to edit leave policy calculation method
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Overwrite option in Payroll Configuration is enabled, preventing changes in Leave Policy
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Disable the 'Overwrite' option in Payroll Configuration → Daily Wage → Unpaid Leave Deduction before attempting to modify leave policy settings

claims_to_validate.title: Values Missing in Leave Salary Accrual Report
claims_to_validate.statement: Values are missing in columns M and N (Accrued Days, Provision Accrued for the month) of the Leave salary accrual report. The daily wage calculation uses calendar days, which may not match custom accounting requirements.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect daily rate in remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in incorrect payroll deduction amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation showed 913 days by including the leap day.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific leave calculation methods. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a global setting instead of policy-level basic salary / working days configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Worked in Gratuity Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing length of service, potentially adding an extra day to gratuity calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The calculation differs from manual expectations by using specific day counting and leap year adjustment methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. This means the same employee's salary can be prorated differently depending on whether it's a leave salary or regular salary proration.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Proration Miscalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates salary proration incorrectly by using 30 days instead of actual calendar days (31 days in August), and does not automatically recalculate prorations when daily rate configuration changes after employee offboarding.

claims_to_validate.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Calculation Challenges
claims_to_validate.statement: The system automatically generates EOS deductions and salary arrears without precise proportional recalculation for employees with non-standard employment status changes, causing potential calculation discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts consistently produces slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors. When calculating End of Service (EOS) amounts, the system shows amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Overwrite Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The greyed-out formula in leave policy indicates that the payroll configuration takes precedence, causing user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Multiple Leave Salary Policy Interaction Bugs
claims_to_validate.statement: Two distinct bugs in leave salary policy configuration: (1) Changes to daily rate calculation in leave salary policy did not take effect until another leave salary policy was set to inactive, indicating incorrect policy precedence or caching issue when multiple leave salary policies exist. (2) Leave salary request was generated for a 5-day leave despite the policy requiring minimum 21 days, indicating the minimum days threshold validation is not working correctly.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is currently being calculated based on basic salary, whereas it should be calculated using gross pay. This represents an incorrect calculation methodology for leave salary accrual reporting.

claims_to_validate.title: Inappropriate GOSI Component Appearance
claims_to_validate.statement: A GOSI (social security) component is incorrectly appearing on reports for a UAE client who has not configured any social security contributions.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals across different months

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Wage Calculation in Leave Salary Accrual Report
claims_to_validate.statement: The system is not applying the configured leave encashment calculation method to the accrual report generation. Reports continue to calculate daily wage based on working days instead of the configured formula (Basic + allowances / 30 days).

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Daily Wage Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates daily wage by dividing total compensation by 21 working days instead of the expected 22 working days in the leave policy. This results in a different End of Service (EOS) calculation amount for employees.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Leave Encashment Calculation Configuration UI Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When configuring leave encashment calculation, the End of Service Eligibility section does not immediately or clearly reflect configuration changes, causing user confusion about whether settings have been successfully applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Unable to Edit Automatically Created Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: System prevents administrators from editing or deleting automatically generated annual leave deductions in End of Service (EOS) calculations. Specifically, attempts to set deduction amounts to zero fail, and the system does not save changes.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect End of Service Calculations for Mid-Month Leavers
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not accurately calculate End of Service (EOS) settlements for employees leaving mid-month with unpaid leave. It calculates EOS deductions using full monthly salary instead of the actual prorated amount paid.

claims_to_validate.title: Unclear Prorated Salary Calculation Process
claims_to_validate.statement: The current salary proration calculation lacks transparency in showing detailed calculation steps. Users cannot easily see how working days are counted and how the proration formula is applied.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrectly Handles Leap Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator does not correctly account for leap years in its calculation logic. When calculating gratuity for an employee with service spanning 2024 (a leap year), the system counts 365 days instead of 366 days, resulting in an incorrect total service period and gratuity amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Misunderstanding
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Salary Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Payroll and Time Off modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Discrepancy in Leave Salary Calculation Days
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on a fixed daily rate configuration in policy, which may differ from user expectations about calendar days. The specific ticket showed a calculation using 30 days instead of 31 calendar days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference (2940 SAR vs expected 2988 SAR).

claims_to_validate.title: System vs Manual Gratuity Calculation Difference
claims_to_validate.statement: Discrepancy between system gratuity calculation (AED 231,821) and manual calculation (AED 252,485) for end of service benefits

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Gratuity Calculation for Limited Contracts
claims_to_validate.statement: The system is producing inconsistent gratuity calculations for limited contract employees. The expected calculation (1200/30*21*2 = 1680 AED) does not match the system's generated amount. Calculation accuracy depends on departure reason and contract type.

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Customized Salary Proration Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The system currently applies a single proration approach across all employees, preventing differentiated calculation methods for distinct employee groups (Head Office vs Operations).

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent UI Display for Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When 'Overwrite' option is enabled in Payroll Configuration → Daily Wage → Unpaid Leave Deduction, the Leave Policy UI shows 'Basic/calendar' while the actual calculation uses 'Basic + Allowance/calendar' from the payroll configuration. This creates user confusion about which calculation method is actually being applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Missing Hourly Wage Information in Salary Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: The current salary configuration does not support hourly wage input, which limits detailed compensation management for users with hourly-based employees or complex wage structures.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Calendar Day Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary accrual report is hardcoded to use actual calendar days for calculations, preventing custom divisor configurations

claims_to_validate.title: Leap Year Day Calculation in Daily Wage
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations must use the actual number of calendar days in a month, with special handling for February in leap years (29 days).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Deduction Calculation Depends on Salary Config Timing
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions are calculated based on salary configuration existing at the time of leave request creation. Changes to salary configuration after leave request may not automatically update deduction calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Service Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated as (basic salary + allowances) / 30, which may not always produce precisely accurate pro-rated amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Nuanced Handling of Incomplete Service Years
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses specific methodology for calculating gratuity in partial years, including: 1. Different calculation for first 5 years (21 days per year) 2. Different calculation for years above 5 years (30 days per year) 3. Special handling of incomplete final year using day-based prorated calculation 4. Leap year adjustment using 366 days divisor when applicable

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent configurations that cannot be automatically aligned

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Locked After Offboarding
claims_to_validate.statement: Prorated salary calculations are locked based on the daily rate configuration at the time of employee offboarding, preventing dynamic updates.

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Transaction Management
claims_to_validate.statement: The system does not automatically reconcile or remove payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified or deleted.

claims_to_validate.title: Complex Employment Status Calculation Handling

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years in Calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days Calculation Depends on Work Week Setup
